page.title: 02THE KING'S FOREST 2
page.content: Population is sparse as basically there are only 8 dwellings near North Stow Hall. The Hall is now a small mixed farm with 2 cows, 30 sheep and horses for riding, but the owner has recently ventured to plant a vineyard, the success of which is unknown. The semi-detached houses have piped water and mains electricity and a gamekeeper lives in one of them. The shooting rights are leased out privately but the F.C. still manages the trees but with consideration for coverts for game bird rearing.There is another row of 3 single storey cottages, one of which is a weekend home. The data countshows the lack of amenities; shops, schools, etc. are in Culford and Brandon, at least 5-7 miles away.
